categories.name: Technical Skills
categories.description: Questions to assess technical competency and problem-solving abilities

questions.question: Explain the difference between abstract classes and interfaces in your preferred programming language.
questions.sampleAnswer: Abstract classes can have implementation while interfaces define contracts. Abstract classes support inheritance hierarchy while interfaces support multiple inheritance.

questions.question: How would you optimize a slow database query?
questions.sampleAnswer: Analyze execution plan, add appropriate indexes, optimize WHERE clauses, consider query restructuring, check for N+1 problems.

questions.question: Describe the SOLID principles and give an example of each.
questions.sampleAnswer: Single Responsibility, Open/Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion - each with practical examples.

questions.question: What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous programming?
questions.sampleAnswer: Synchronous blocks execution until completion, asynchronous allows other operations to continue while waiting for completion.

questions.question: Explain RESTful API design principles and HTTP methods.
questions.sampleAnswer: REST principles include statelessness, uniform interface, cacheable responses. HTTP methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH with proper usage.

categories.name: Behavioral & Soft Skills
categories.description: Questions to assess communication, teamwork, and problem-solving approach

questions.question: Tell me about a time when you had to work with a difficult team member. How did you handle it?
questions.sampleAnswer: STAR method response focusing on situation, task, action taken, and positive result achieved through communication and collaboration.

questions.question: Describe a challenging project you worked on and how you overcame obstacles.
questions.sampleAnswer: Specific project example with clear obstacles, systematic approach to solutions, lessons learned, and successful outcome.

questions.question: How do you prioritize tasks when you have multiple deadlines?
questions.sampleAnswer: Assessment of urgency vs importance, stakeholder communication, breaking down tasks, using prioritization frameworks like Eisenhower Matrix.

questions.question: Give an example of when you had to learn a new technology quickly.
questions.sampleAnswer: Specific technology, learning approach used, resources utilized, timeline, and successful application in project.

questions.question: How do you handle feedback and criticism?
questions.sampleAnswer: Open to feedback, active listening, asking clarifying questions, implementing suggestions, following up on improvements.

categories.name: Leadership & Management
categories.description: Questions for senior roles focusing on leadership and strategic thinking

questions.question: How do you motivate a team during challenging times?
questions.sampleAnswer: Clear communication, transparency about challenges, focusing on purpose, recognizing contributions, providing support and resources.

questions.question: Describe your approach to making difficult decisions with incomplete information.
questions.sampleAnswer: Gather available data, consult stakeholders, assess risks, make informed assumptions, create contingency plans, communicate rationale.

questions.question: How do you handle underperforming team members?
questions.sampleAnswer: Identify root causes, provide clear expectations, offer support and training, create improvement plan, regular check-ins, document progress.

categories.name: Role-Specific Questions
categories.description: Questions tailored to specific job roles and responsibilities

questions.question: Explain the Flutter widget lifecycle and state management approaches.
questions.sampleAnswer: Widget lifecycle: createState, initState, build, setState, dispose. State management: Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, setState for local state.

questions.question: How do you prioritize features in a product roadmap?
questions.sampleAnswer: User impact analysis, business value assessment, technical feasibility, resource requirements, market timing, stakeholder input.
evaluationCriteria: Balance of user and business needs

questions.question: Walk me through your design process from research to final design.
questions.sampleAnswer: User research, persona creation, user journey mapping, wireframing, prototyping, usability testing, iteration, final design, handoff.
